page.title: 14 A Wolverhampton Market
page.content: Wednesfield Market is in the centre of the town. It opens on Tuesdays,Fridays and Saturdays. Everybody seems to use the market and you always meet friends there. There are 61 stalls and 8 shops. Sellers come from all over the Midlands from Brownhills, Sedgeley, Wellington, Stourbridge, Kinswinford and even as far away as Coventry. The market opened on its present site in June 1970. The council moved it from one side of Alfred Squire Road to the other. It had been on its first site since the council began the market 1961. A man called Councillor S.Reynolds did a lot to get the idea of a Wednesfield market started in the town. The market has a superintendent to look after everthing and even a cafe for the stallholders and shoppers.
